goal: Create engaging short-form content about lebron james and the lakers using insights from research and video analysis

segments.title: Segment: LeBron James, Los Angeles Lakers, Lakers are washed, NBA, Basketball

visual.description: LeBron hit the Lakers with his agent's statement to the media saying, oh, he's not happy.

Then he posts all passive aggressive, like did you see the Lakers sideline reporter wearing a Cavs jersey on her vacation? LeBron comments, now that is proper attire. What? That is a savage comment to make about another team's jersey that you don't even play for.
All but the Lakers hit back.
So Ramona Shelburne is an LA-based reporter for ESPN, famously connected with the Lakers governor Genie Buss. So when Ramona says team sources, she's talking about Genie Buss, not LeBron.
How bad is it right now between the Lakers and LeBron? Let's just say it's over.

They are basically saying, yo, you could keep playing in the NBA if you want, but it ain't gonna be for the Los Angeles Lakers. Why is LA being so mean to one of the greatest players of all time? Because they've got a plan, and it doesn't involve LeBron James.
First, they called a big meeting to discuss the future in LA right after losing the first round. It was GM Rob Pelinka, coach JJ Reddick, Luca and his agent.

Then, when the Lakers were sold from the Buss family to the Guggenheim Group recently for 10 billion bucks, they gave Luca a heads up, but not LeBron. I mean, that is like borderline petty. Why would you give Luca a heads up and not LeBron? But apparently, LeBron didn't mind any of this. He could forgive it all. But the one thing he cannot forgive is what they're doing on the court. The Lakers are planning something called Project 2027.

Now to accomplish that, they only offered Dorian Finney-Smith a two-year deal. So when Houston swooped in with a four-year offer, he left. 2027 is also why they didn't offer LeBron a new contract. And it's why their only moves this off season, getting Deandre Ayton, Jake Lavernia, and signing Jackson Hayes, all have expiring deals as soon as 2027. And do you think that LeBron would agree to any of that? No. Can you imagine how awkward that dinner would have been with that big binder? LeBron would have thrown that binder in the trash. It is all about right now for LeBron. Forget 2027.

And I actually get why he's so upset. I mean, you guys have Luca Doncic and LeBron James right now. And LeBron just played like a top 10 player last season. Not only was he top six in MVP voting, but he was second team All-NBA, which means he was a top 10 player by definition. So if you take away his age, his name, you just look at his stats and performance, the Lakers have a win now big too.

But before we look at the details of Project 2027 for the Lakers, what is LeBron actually want them to do right now? Because I would get if there was some obvious move to make that they just refused to make. Like, remember when they could have gotten Kyrie Irving a few years ago? He had a horrible reputation in Brooklyn so they could have got him for cheap, but LA refused to do that and he goes to Dallas instead for cheap and they make the finals. Like that was a big mistake, an obvious move out there that they refused to do. But right now, what is it, LeBron? Andrew Wiggins? Really?

I honestly think that if a championship move was out there right now, the Lakers would consider it. But you tell me what they should do right now. Jonathan Cumminga? It's a joke. So, believe it or not, the Lakers do have eyes on two gigantic names for the future.

Their best offer for Giannis includes a variety of players, maybe a Rui Hachimura, maybe an Austin Reeves on a sign and trade, I don't know, Jared Vanderbilt, Dalton Knecht for sure, but three first round picks, 2026, 2031 and 2033, plus three swaps, 28, 31 and 32. Now, I'm not saying it's likely, but LA has a plan. Now, does Giannis actually want to be a Laker? Because that seems kind of relevant. Well, did you hear what Giannis just said about that with I show speed? A lot of people try to convince me, try to convince me to go and play there and stuff. Oh, no. Not great. Now Giannis might have been trolling a bit, because he also was like, am I gonna play in Milwaukee? He said, probably, I don't know, we'll see. Probably. Probably. We'll see. Yeah, so he's doing a little trolling. But there is one other name, and it's Nicola Jokic. Now normally I would say that Joker is a one team guy his whole career, like Dirk Nowitzki or Tim Duncan. But did you see what the Nuggets owner just said the other day? Like completely unprompted. No one even asked him a question. Dude said this.

Jokic also did not sign a new contract extension with Denver, which, by the way, was expected because he can make more money later. But this is the Lakers' plan, okay? And if it doesn't work, plan A, they can always shift to plan B. Use that cap space and picks for lesser role players around Luca, not a big superstar yet. And that might actually be a better plan. Luca, we know, thrives with role players, and depth is working right now in the NBA pretty well.

Either way, Luca is the key, not LeBron. So what is LeBron going to do next? Well, he can either retire after next season, or play for another team, because the Lakers are not going to give him a new contract, which is actually pretty crazy. This is huge news. We know this coming season will be the last year for LeBron in LA. So does he demand a trade? I seriously doubt that, because he makes so much money that it would gut any team that could get him.

A report said that when LeBron's agent Rich Paul put out that statement a couple weeks ago, four teams reached out to the Lakers, but nothing is actually seriously close to happening right now. Another option would be a buyout, but I don't see the Lakers having 50 million in dead money on their books for LeBron. And if LeBron actually wanted to buy out, why did he pick up that option in the first place? Now, Luca can sign a new Lakers contract starting August 2nd, and if he likes their plan to build around him instead of LeBron, then we officially have a new era in LA. But I already did a deep dive on where LeBron could go next.

When Rich Paul put out that statement, I looked at which teams have a realistic chance to get him. And some people immediately said, oh, what about the Dallas Mavericks? Because they've got AD and Kyrie, LeBron's good friends. But there's a very good reason why the Mavs are not on that list. I think it is a short list of just three teams where LeBron could end his career.

segments.title: Segment: LeBron James, Smirk, Big Lebowski, Quote, Opinion

visual.description: Visual concept for: Visual: Close up on LeBron's face, a slight smirk appears. Audio: 'That's just like your opinion, man...' (Big Lebowski quote).

title: LeBron Reacts to the Haters (Big Lebowski Meme)
